lines.text: Boogedy boo. Just kidding! BOOOOGEDY! Just kidding!
[Line repeats several more times]

[In fright]
It's Mr. Boogedy! I saw him! He's back!

[Sarcastically]
Oh I'm sure you did. Was he real big and scary?
Daddy!
Did he drool all over you?
Did he bite your neck?
Carleton!

[about a gag in Carleton's hand]
What is that?
This?
Yeah.

[Carleton squirts Elmer, and family laughs at him]
Gag City!

[Sarcastically]
I'm going to get even with you.

[while Boogedy-Carleton chase family]
Good Lord! What's that bonehead up to now?

[after stealing the magic cloak]
So this is the secret of your success, eh Davis? Magic! Well two can play at that one my FRIEND! When I'm through with you, you and your family will be sorry you ever moved to Lucifer Falls!

[Boy puts a Gag City toy on Lynch's forehead]
WHY DON'T YOU TEACH THESE KIDS SOME MANNERS? Go on!
It's a statue.
We knew that. Who are you?
I'm Lazarus. I dig graves.
Uh, huh. Sounds like fun. We gotta go.
Wait! Don't you want to see it?

[Referring to the statue]
It's been here as long as the graveyard. Maybe longer.
Who's it of?
William Hanover.
That's Mr. Boogedy!

[Voice disguing like Mr. Boogedy]
Jennifer Davis... it's Mr. Boogedy. Get out of my house!
[Sinister laughing]
AAAAAAHHHHH!
[Crying]
We have had this carnival for as long as I can remember.

[Whispering]
That must be a VERY long time.
Well Mrs. Hooter, I've had WARTS for as long as I can remember.
You're going to get it now Carleton.
Heh, heh, heh! Lynch, give me my cloak.
No Mr. Lynch! Don't do it! Don't listen to him!
LYNCH NOW! I WANT MY CLOAK NNNNOOOOOWWWWW!

[Lynch is consumed by Boogedy's power]
Oh, great.
Mr. Lynch has been Boogedyized.

[as Boogedy's voice]
Marion!
Oh no, not again!
What's he doing now?
I think he's taking a nap on the ceiling.

[Carleton snoring]
He's tired. He had a long day.

[Talking to himself]
Oh God. I guess I was a little hasty. It's not like I was asking for thier first born or anything.

[Looking for Boogedy in the woods]
There! He was right there!

[Bushes rush]
Ow! You see anything?
[Throws a rock, cat screeches]
Aw, Jennifer! You little baby!
Yeah Jennifer!
Booged goes! Come on.
Please Mr. Witherspoon. You've got to help us. My father was floating down the hallway last night.
Well your father IS strange.
Maybe. But even he can't float in mid-air.

[Looking for Mr. Lynch in the woods]
Oh Mr. Lynch! I think I see you. Are you over here?
[Trips and falls]
Ow! Ooh! I'm OK, OK!
Elois, look at this! He completly wrecked my microphone! I'm going to get him for this!
Get who?
Look.
[Hands over a pilgrim hat]
"T.R Lynch," I should have known.
That's terrible!
Would you believe it; a grown man acting like a little boy.
What are you going to do dad? Punch his lights out!
First things first to mob to lynch Lynch!
Carleton! I think you boys are getting carried away. This isn't going to make matters any better.
Mom's right guys. I mean, just because he ruined my new microphone and practically eletricuted me. I'll blow up his store.
Yeah!
It's Lynch. He must of followed us home.
Can you see him?
No! He's hidding. Coward!
Well let's go get him!
Yeah!

[Hold back the boys]
No wait! Carleton, you're an adult. I don't want any fighting!
But Mom!
Elois, this is differen't. He's sneaking up on our house. This is war!
Yeah Mom, war.
Dad's right. We can't let him get away with this.
Alright you two stay here and protect the women.

[entering the General Store]
Helloooo? Mr. Lynch? Hey, we brought you a poster.
So?
Hey, Corwin! Look at this!
[goes over to several barrels of old, broken toys]
See? There's dribble glasses, and buzzers...
And spiders!
[picks up a rubber spider out of the barrel, the legs fall off]
Aw, yuck!
What's wrong with these things?
What's wrong with it? I'll tell you what's wrong with it! Bad little boys and girls who like to touch and BREAK things!
We didn't break anything!
Yeah! It's already broken! It's all old stuff!
Well, it can't be all new stuff like your father has! See, this works!
[picks up a kaleidascope]
All you have to do is...
[he takes it away from his face, the kaleidascope has left a black ring around his eye. The kids snicker]
Well, it just needs a slight adjustment, is all.
You know, you might have more people in here if you weren't so mean.

Oh, is that right? Well, we all can't be as popular as your father is! We don't want your kind here in Lucifer Falls! And we certaintly don't need another joke store, we've got all the jokes this town can handle, right here!
But this is a hardware store.
Oh, is that so? Well it just so happens, this is a *General Store* little Miss Know It All!
[Jennifer spots Lynch's cloak and brimmed hat on the hat stand and is reminded of seeing Mr. Boogedy in the woods]

[looks over to the hat rack, then back to Jennifer]
What are you looking at?
Nothing.
Did your father send you here to spy on me?
*Spy* on you?

[picks up the poster and tears it in half]
Hey! What'd you do that for?
I don't like posters!
So? You didn't have to tear it up!
I don't like carnivals! And I don't like kids! So, go on, get out of here! Beat it!
[shoos the kids out of the store]
Go on! You should have got out of that house when you had the chance!
[the kids leave]
Heh Heh Heh Heh! So, tried to pull a fast one on me, huh Davis? Well, when I get through with you...
[sighs]
, you'll be sorry you ever moved to Lucifer Falls.
[picks up the kaleidascope again, which still doesn't work, not knowing the gag has left another black circle under his other eye. He puts it back in the barrel]
Hmmph. Junk.

[a dark figure comes up the hallway in the wax musuem, his face masked in the cloak. He stretches out his arm and green lightning shoots out]
It's him!
[back at the graveyard the split statue of William Hanover begins to bubble between the halves]
It's Mr. Boogedy!
[the figure steps closer and removes the hood]
Mr. Lynch!
It's mine now!
You stole it from us!
You people think you're so smart! Fooling everyone into liking you! Making believe you're stupid!
Why would we make believe?
Mr. Lynch, we don't have to fight! We can be friends!
Ha! That's rich!
You don't need a magic cloak to make friends!
Easy for you to say! After you humiliate me in public, and steal the carnival right out from under me!
Mr. Lynch, that cloak is *evil*.
Yeah, sure it is. So evil, I should just take it off and give it over to you?
[Lynch moves over to the wax figure over the pot and waves his hand so the figure looks at him]
Very clever Davis, very clever. See, you use this cloak so you can weasel your way into Lucifer Falls
[he waves his hand and the statue's head faces forward]
... and become mayor of Lucifest.
No, no, that's not true. People would like to get to know you, if you gave them a chance...
Stop being so mean.
Mr. Lynch, we'll be your friends.

[motions to the kids]
What about them?

[the kids nod their heads]
Mmm hmm.
No, it's a trick! Yeah, one of your stupid little *gags* isn't it, Davis?
[turns to leave]
No, No!
[motion for him to come back]

[a smokey, bubbling cloud apparition appears before Lynch]
Lynch! The Cloak! Bring me The Cloak!
No, Mr. Lynch! Don't give it to him! Bring it to us!
Now, Lynch, Now! I want that cloak! Now!
[the smokey, bubbling apparition envelops Lynch, energizing him with the spirit of Mr. Boogedy. Lynch's hair stands on end and he begins to spin]
Oh, great!
Mr. Lynch has been Boogedyized!

[now posessed by the spirit of Mr. Boogedy, Lynch reaches out to Eloise and speaks in Mr. Boogedy's ghostly voice]
Marian!
it's the only carnival in the whole world with their super duper, super natural...
[slaps a sticky circle with a picture of an eye on it, to his forehead]
third eye!
You tell fortunes with an electric crystal ball?
Honey, this is the 20th century.
